intro: Micromeria rivas-martinezii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in desert scrub habitats. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming during the spring and early summer. It has narrow, linear leaves and a compact growth form adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Micromeria rivas-martinezii is part of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its drought tolerance and ecological importance to desert ecosystems.
